name: Sample Player (Sliced)
description: This algorithm allows you to place a number of marker points on a sample, and conveniently trigger playback from the various marker points. It's your go-to algorithm for breakbeat slicing. Please review the section on the features common to the various Sample Players, above.

parameters.name: Slice
parameters.description: Offsets the choice of which slice to play. Provided as a convenience when triggering playback with the 'Play' parameter.

parameters.name: Slices
parameters.description: Sets the number of slices in use.

parameters.name: Stop at slice end
parameters.description: If enabled, playback will stop when it reaches the next slice. Otherwise, playback continues to the end of the sample.

parameters.name: Auto trigger
parameters.description: Sets whether the sample will automatically be triggered by the clock. This can be at a fixed interval, or set automatically by the length of the loop.

parameters.name: Auto divisor
parameters.description: Sets how often the sample will be triggered, if 'Auto trigger' is 'Fixed'.

parameters.name: Time sig denom
parameters.description: The time signature denominator: one of 1, 2, 4, 8, or 16.

parameters.name: Slice input
parameters.description: The bus to use for the slice CV input (V/oct, scaled at one semitone per slice).

parameters.name: Clock input
parameters.description: The bus to use for the clock input (24 ppqn).

parameters.name: Run/stop input
parameters.description: The bus to use for the run/stop input.

parameters.name: Coarse
parameters.description: The coarse slice position, as a percentage of the sample length.

parameters.name: Fine
parameters.description: The fine slice position, in sample frames.

parameters.name: Speed
parameters.description: The playback speed for the slice.
